title: GreenFerries Data and API platform
description_html:
This platform exposes data used for the GreenFerries website.
You can browse the data on your web browser using this website, and it also provides a JSON API interface, for example: http://127.0.0.1:8001/greenferries/wikidata.json?maximumCapacity__gt=300 is the API route to list all the information scraped from Wikidata for ships with a capacity over 300 persons.

greenferries.description_html:
This platform exposes various datasets used for the GreenFerries website
See all datasets and usage instructions.
This is the actual data used on the website. It was generated by importing data from the different other datasets (wikipedia, thetis etc), and curated manually through an admin interface: https://github.com/adipasquale/greenferries-admin.

thetis.description_html:
This platform exposes various datasets used for the GreenFerries website
See all datasets and usage instructions.
This is the raw data published on the THETIS-MRV platform website. It was generated by transforming the downloadable XLS export into a CSV, with column names remapped to more usable slug versions. You can find and reproduce the process using this Python script

scrapings.description_html:
This platform exposes various datasets used for the GreenFerries website
See all datasets and usage instructions.
This data was scraped from directferries.fr. You can find the puppeteer crawlers code on this GitHub repository. The results were not incredibly satisfying but gave a decent base to populate the ship routes in GreenFerries. Most of the routes have been inserted manually after however.
